[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Struct: SourceContext] [Memory exhaustion] Can an attacker provide malformed bytecode or source files that cause the SourceContext fields (left, highlight, remainder) to allocate unbounded memory, leading to OOM crashes in the bytecode viewer tool? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Struct: SourceContext] [String injection] If SourceContext.highlight or SourceContext.remainder contain malicious terminal escape sequences or ANSI codes from untrusted bytecode comments, can this lead to terminal injection attacks when displayed to developers? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Struct: SourceContext] [Data integrity] Does the SourceContext struct have any validation to ensure that left + highlight + remainder form a coherent view, or can inconsistent string boundaries cause display corruption or information disclosure? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Struct: SourceContext] [Clone safety] Given that SourceContext derives Clone, can large string allocations be accidentally duplicated multiple times causing memory pressure when viewing large Move modules? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait: LeftScreen] [Method: get_source_index_for_line] [Bounds checking] Can implementations of get_source_index_for_line return out-of-bounds SourceIndex values when given malformed line/column inputs, potentially causing panics in RightScreen consumers? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait: LeftScreen] [Method: get_source_index_for_line] [Integer overflow] If a malicious bytecode file causes line or column parameters to be near usize::MAX, can integer overflow occur in implementations that perform arithmetic on these values before bounds checking? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait: LeftScreen] [Method: get_source_index_for_line] [NULL dereference] Does the Option<&Self::SourceIndex> return type guarantee that implementations properly handle cases where no mapping exists, or can Some() be returned with invalid references? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait: LeftScreen] [Method: get_source_index_for_line] [Race condition] If multiple threads call get_source_index_for_line concurrently on a shared LeftScreen implementation, can race conditions in the underlying HashMap lookup cause data races or incorrect SourceIndex returns? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait: LeftScreen] [Method: backing_string] [Memory exhaustion] Can backing_string() be called repeatedly on very large disassembled modules causing excessive string allocations and memory exhaustion in the viewer tool? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait: LeftScreen] [Method: backing_string] [Content validation] Does backing_string() perform any sanitization on the returned string, or can malicious bytecode inject escape sequences or binary data that corrupt terminal displays? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait: LeftScreen] [Type: SourceIndex] [Type confusion] Can different LeftScreen implementations use incompatible SourceIndex types that cause type confusion when mixed in generic contexts, leading to logic errors? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait: LeftScreen] [Type: SourceIndex] [Lifetime issues] Does the associated type SourceIndex have proper lifetime constraints to prevent dangling references when the LeftScreen implementation is dropped while SourceIndex references exist? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait: RightScreen] [Method: source_for_code_location] [Error propagation] Can source_for_code_location return Err() values that expose sensitive file system paths or internal implementation details in error messages shown to users? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait: RightScreen] [Method: source_for_code_location] [Invalid index handling] If bytecode_info parameter contains corrupted FunctionDefinitionIndex or CodeOffset values from a malformed module, can this cause panics or incorrect source mapping leading to confusion? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait: RightScreen] [Method: source_for_code_location] [Context window attack] Can an attacker craft bytecode with code locations that cause source_for_code_location to return SourceContext with extremely large context windows (CONTEXT_SIZE), exhausting memory? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait: RightScreen] [Method: source_for_code_location] [String slicing panic] If the implementation slices source strings using bytecode_info offsets without proper bounds checking, can out-of-bounds indices cause panics when viewing malformed modules? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait: RightScreen] [Method: source_for_code_location] [UTF-8 boundary] Can bytecode with source locations that fall on invalid UTF-8 boundaries cause string slicing to panic or produce mojibake when constructing SourceContext? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait: RightScreen] [Method: backing_string] [File content exposure] Does backing_string() return the entire source file contents without redaction, potentially exposing sensitive comments or credentials in source code to unauthorized viewers? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait: RightScreen] [Generic constraint] [Type safety] Can the Indexer: LeftScreen generic bound be violated by passing incompatible types, causing type confusion between different bytecode viewer implementations? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait: RightScreen] [Generic constraint] [Lifetime mismatch] If Indexer has a lifetime parameter (like BytecodeViewer<'a>), can lifetime mismatches between RightScreen and Indexer cause use-after-free or dangling reference issues? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait interaction] [BytecodeInfo validity] When LeftScreen::get_source_index_for_line returns BytecodeInfo, can the function_index or code_offset be out of bounds relative to the compiled module, causing RightScreen::source_for_code_location to fail? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait interaction] [Source map desync] If the source map used by RightScreen is out of sync with the bytecode indexed by LeftScreen, can this cause incorrect source highlighting or misleading debugging information? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Trait interaction] [Null reference safety] Does the trait design prevent implementations from returning Some(&invalid_ref) from get_source_index_for_line, or can invalid pointers be wrapped in Option::Some? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Overall design] [Trust boundary] Does the trait design assume that bytecode and source files are trusted, or is there validation to handle malicious or corrupted inputs safely? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-bytecode-viewer/src/interfaces.rs] [Overall design] [Error handling consistency] Are all Result returns from RightScreen::source_for_code_location properly handled by callers, or can unhandled errors lead to tool crashes or undefined behavior? (Low)
